An astute question, my good sir! The genesis of this particular enterprise, like all great endeavors, was born not of a singular, sudden flash of inspiration, but rather from a meticulous admixture of observation, erudition, and a profound appreciation for the path of least resistance. You see, "Gentlemen, I believe you are all aware that the Solons of the State of Mississippi, to wit, its legislature, have decreed that no gaming establishment shall be erected... But while the gambling activity itself is restricted to riverboats, no such restriction applies to the functions ancillary to this cash besotted bidnis... And most importantly its counting houses... may all be situated... wherever." And as it happens, the chosen "wherever" for the Lady Luck's repository of lucre is a vault whose walls are not forged of grim, unyielding steel, but rather "humble masonry, behind which is only the soft loamy soil deposited over the centuries by Ol' Man, the meanderin' Mississip', as it fanned its way back and forth across this great alluvial plain... This earth." Thus, the solution presented itself not as a challenge of brute force, but as a simple matter of subterranean navigation. A delicate archeological dig, if you will, straight to the heart of the matter.Both models produce high-quality audio and successfully adopt the persona of Professor G.H. Dorr.
